content:
I am getting this link error : "The link '#.html' for "Jira Issue" cannot be resolved ...."

how do I represent a self-link ?

Sometimes in your workflow, you don’t want a live link or you won’t know the link destination yet. In this case, it’s useful to set the href attribute to "#" to create a dead link.

https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/the-a-href-attribute-explained/
I want a "dead link" to create the link formatting for a header
well, of course it's a dead link
Why would you not want an error until you fixed the link? If you give the FMG a good reason why the link can't be known, they'd probably let you go to ballot (but perhaps not to final publication).
I want the link to be dead, because I want the formatting. but never mind its not that important.
If you want formatting, then use formatting. (Ideally formatting that doesn't make something that's not a link look like a link...)
Except that you're creating something that is, in fact, a broken link using a hack instead of just declaring formatting properly. (It's easy to create broken links in XHTML too...)
It is not a broken link, but a commonly used way to create a dead link.
Dead = broken. If you hover over it, it looks like you can jump somewhere. And if you click on it, you go nowhere. It would also be tab-able if anyone tried navigating that way.
Eric Haas has marked this topic as resolved.
